item.title: Juan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let others pride themselves about how many pages they have written; I'd rather boast about the ones I've read." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Juan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Juan add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Juan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Juan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Juan add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Juan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Juan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Juan add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Juan add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Juan add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Juan add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Juan add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Juan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Juan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Juan add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Juan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Juan add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Juan add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If you're going to read this, don't bother." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Juan add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Tyler gets me a job as a waiter, after that Tyler's pushing a gun in my mouth and saying, the first step to eternal life is you have to die." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Juan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "It was a pleasure to burn." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Juan add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Barrabas came to us by sea, the child Clara wrote in her delicate calligraphy. " -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Juan add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "I was very young and lived with my grandparents in a villa with white walls in the Calle Ocharan, in Miraflores." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Juan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano Buendía was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice..." -- Gabriel García Márquez
